data.name: How not to waste a crisis: sources of entrepreneurial opportunity and start-up financing
data.summary:
In this webinar, we look to the future with two members of the entrepreneurship faculty, Luisa Alemany and Rupert Merson. It is often said that every crisis is also an opportunity, and indeed research has shown that that businesses founded in a crisis are more likely to last than those founded in boom times.

Building on this observation, Luisa and Rupert will discuss the nature of the opportunities emerging from the current crisis for both entrepreneurs and early stage investors, such as business angels and venture capitalists.
data.speakers: Luisa Alemany, Associate Professor of Management Practice and Rupert Merson, Adjunct Professor
